seisflows.plugins.solver_io package¶

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.adios module¶

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.adios.mread(path, parameters, iproc, prefix='', suffix='')[source]¶

Multiparameter read, callable by a single mpi process

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.adios.read(path, parameter, iproc)[source]¶

Reads from ADIOS container

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.adios.write(v, path, parameter, iproc)[source]¶

Writes to ADIOS container

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.fortran_binary module¶

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.fortran_binary.copy_slice(src, dst, iproc, parameter)[source]¶

Copies SPECFEM model slice

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.fortran_binary.read_slice(path, parameters, iproc)[source]¶

Reads SPECFEM model slice(s) Such as, for example : proc000005_vp.bin In that specific case it would be : read_slice(path, ‘vp’, 5)

seisflows.plugins.solver_io.fortran_binary.write_slice(data, path, parameters, iproc)[source]¶

Writes SPECFEM model slice
